question: Which of the following Cyclones that struck India is different from others?
explanation: While Ockhi was a cyclone in Arabian Sea; Roanu, Nada and Vardah originated in Bay of Bengal region. Cyclone Roanu was a relatively weak tropical cyclone that caused severe flooding in Sri Lanka and Bangladesh in May 2016. Nada was a result of a low-pressure area formed in the extreme south-eastern part of the Bay of Bengal. It badly damaged the coastal areas of Tamil Nadu in India. Cyclone Vardah was a result of a low-pressure area formed in the Malay Peninsula and adjoining north Sumatra, in early December 2016. Ockhi was a strong tropical cyclone in the Arabian Sea. It badly struck the west coast of India.
